body:
Windows 10, Python 3.8.3, Cython 3.0a6, Visual Studio 2017 version 15.9.20.

The following (admittedly meaningless) example

```cython
cdef cppclass i
new i()
```

when written to `b.pyx` and compiled with `cython b.pyx --cplus`, produces the following message:

```
b.pyx:2:4: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform

File 'Nodes.py', line 390, in analyse_expressions: StatListNode(b.pyx:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 5505, in analyse_expressions: ExprStatNode(b.pyx:2:5)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 605, in analyse_expressions: SimpleCallNode(b.pyx:2:5,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 5683, in analyse_types: SimpleCallNode(b.pyx:2:5,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 1867, in analyse_types: NewExprNode(b.pyx:2:4,
    is_called = 1,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 1859, in infer_type: NewExprNode(b.pyx:2:4,
    is_called = 1,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "...\python\python3.8.3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\ExprNodes.py", line 1859, in infer_type
    constructor = type.get_constructor(self.pos)
  File "...\python\python3.8.3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\PyrexTypes.py", line 4004, in get_constructor
    constructor = self.scope.lookup('<init>')
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'lookup'
```
title: [BUG] Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform
